awd_titl_txt: SBIR Phase I:  IoT-Enabled Intelligent Data Replication for Secure Redundant Monitoring
awd_abstract_narration:
The broader impact/commercial potential of this Phase I project is to increase the visibility and availability of data used for control and automation of critical infrastructures. This research proposes the development of a novel technology that takes advantage of flexible, low cost, and low power internet of things (IoT) devices to replicate, transmit, and analyze relevant monitoring and control data. Blackouts in the U.S. cause tens of billions of dollars in outage cost annually. This technology will advance the nation's energy safety, security, and economy by improving the capabilities of critical infrastructure systems to respond to blackouts caused by anomalous events such as natural disasters (e.g., hurricanes, winter storms) and localized faults or cyberattacks. Therefore, the technology developed in this project will decrease restoration time and provide real-time defense against cyberattacks, reducing the loss of electricity to critical users such as hospitals and governmental facilities, and saving billions of dollars. 


This Small Business Innovation Research (SBIR) Phase I project will advance the scientific knowledge required to enhance the resilience of critical infrastructures through the integration of IoT networks, monitoring and control technologies, and data analytics.  Advances in the use of IoT devices for critical infrastructures integrated with security mechanisms will facilitate the technology transition of the current critical infrastructure. This project will explore and design novel mechanisms for data processing, light-weight encryption, and attack detection. The technology developed in this project will have widespread applications in monitoring and control, not only in the electricity sector, but also in many other critical infrastructures such as water, oil, and gas. A proof of concept will be developed to validate the feasibility of the proposed architecture and algorithms.

This award reflects NSF's statutory mission and has been deemed worthy of support through evaluation using the Foundation's intellectual merit and broader impacts review criteria.

por.por_cntn:
During Phase I, the project team successfully designed and implemented a functional prototype of the SUNIGate solution, which is an innovative technology for secure collection, transmission, analysis, and visualization of energy assets such as EV chargers, power inverters, and fault indicators. SUNIGate consists of an IoT data gateway that securely transmits the collected information to a cloud-based platform using Grid Modernization Solution's proprietary and patent-pending architecture. The SUNIGate gateway is compatible with multiple industrial communication protocols such as Modbus and OCPP (Open Charging Point Protocol) for various applications. The SUNIGate cloud-based platform processes the information to detect and mitigate potential cyber attacks; a user-friendly dashboard enables users to monitor the status of their devices and facilitate their decision-making process. As part of this Phase I project, a pilot implementation in a facility with multiple EV chargers demonstrated the feasibility of the SUNIGate solution during multiple cyber attack scenarios. For instance, false data injection attacks on the measurements collected from EV chargers were detected and mitigated, allowing the charging management system to continue working without harming the EV charging operation.
The SUNIGate solution enables situational awareness for critical infrastructure operators and energy managers, and provides real-time defense against cyber attacks, reducing the loss or misuse of electricity to critical users such as hospitals, governmental facilities, and electric vehicle (EV) charging infrastructure, saving billions of dollars for the public and private organizations. Protecting energy assets such as renewable energy resources and the growing EV charging infrastructure ensures security and public trust in integrating emerging sustainability technologies.  Furthermore, the SUNIGate solution advances the security of U.S. critical infrastructure by improving its capabilities to detect and mitigate cyber attacks using fast and low-complexity strategies
